file_results.false_positive_reason: The flagged subprocess.check_output calls are used to query system configuration (e.g., pkg-config, brew, xcrun) to locate libraries and include paths for building a Python C extension. These commands are static, well-known, and do not involve network access, code injection, or execution of arbitrary/untrusted code. The code is a typical build script for a Python package (setup.py/build_ext), and all subprocess invocations are for legitimate build-time discovery of dependencies. There is no evidence of obfuscation, data exfiltration, privilege escalation, or other malicious behaviors. The use of subprocess in this context is common and benign in open-source build scripts.
